intro: Lepturus gasparricensis, commonly known as the Gasparrini's lepturus, is a rare flowering plant native to the humid forests of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and has slender, hairy stems. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine pubescence. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months, contributing to its ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
